intro: Pedilonum gnomus, commonly known as the fairy lantern, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features slender, upright stems covered in soft, hairy foliage that helps it retain moisture in arid conditions. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white, which bloom in late summer. Its root system is fibrous and adapted to shallow soil, allowing it to thrive in rocky, well-drained environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Pedilonum gnomus is considered a vulnerable species.
